intro: Babiana stricta var. reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a basal rosette, while its stems are erect and often branched. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
